Steps to reproduce:

  1. Get a customer phone call that booked an activity (e.g. Werktour)
  2. The customer wants to join the tour tomorrow instead of today
  3. The Werktour tomorrow is fully booked
  4. You propose an alternative tour to the customer (Turmfahrt)
  5. He accepts the alternative

Actual result:

A user can only propose an alternative appointment date and time for the original product that has been booked
In order to propose an alternative activity, you have to cancel the booking and place a new booking

Expected result:

User should be able to propose an alternative activity without having to cancel the booking and re-entering the customer data

@Walid Dechri, @Naomi,

  1. Issue with statistics is resolved now, and most probably was caused by the full reindex running in background, causing delays in statistics re-indexing.
  2. Issue with calendar and improper behavior of date and time picker is fixed.

Please, re-test.

Test steps:
1. Statistics:

  1. Go to resellers dashboard.
  2. Open any normal booking (not redeemed, not voucher).
  3. Go to Statistics Export: https://www.regiondo-test-uk.de/resellers/account/statisticsexport
  4. Filter by the open booking key. Check that corresponding records are present.
  5. Alter the open booking to a different product/variation/date/time/qty.
  6. Reload the statistics and ensure that records are updated: they should contain new product name, variation/option name, dates. The number of records should correspond the new Qty.

2. Date/Time picker

  1. Go to resellers dashboard.
  2. Open any normal booking, with appointment date in next months (not current month). Example: Booking Number #1576155232012912900
  3. Select any other date without changing the month.
  4. Make sure that there are suggested times and options for the selected date.
  5. Change the product to a different one.
  6. Select any other date without changing the month.
  7. Make sure that there are suggested times and options for the selected date.

OAuth Authorization with password and refresh_token grants implemented.

Deployment

  1. Deploy the codebase to the server.
  2. Install dependencies via composer: 
    composer install --no-dev
  3. Run migrations in Magento to create necessary tables.
  4. Adjust the Server configuration as described below.

API Server configuration
Example configuration added to app/config/config.php.example.

  1. Section oauth has to be added to app/config/config.php, the following adjustments have to be made:
  • Configure public and private keys:
    • generate Private and Public keys as described at https://oauth2.thephpleague.com/installation/#generating-public-and-private-keys
    • mount the keys to container or put them to server
    • configure the paths to keys on server in app/config/config.php
  • Configure the encryption key:
    • generate encryption key as described at https://oauth2.thephpleague.com/installation/#generating-encryption-keys
    • configure the encryption key in app/config/config.php
  • Adjust the tokens expiration intervals if needed.
  • Generate and put any random client secret for POS client.

Details for client implementation

  • Authorising with password: https://oauth2.thephpleague.com/authorization-server/resource-owner-password-credentials-grant/
  • Refreshing the access token: https://oauth2.thephpleague.com/authorization-server/refresh-token-grant/

Important changes:

  • Composer usage introduced globally for the project. Locally installed dependencies (for Mongo) were merged to global file.
  • Obsolete gyg SDK, tests, controller file, and index file were removed from repository

In a nutshell: Starting from February 2020 all cookies without explicitly set SameSite attribute will be treated as if they have SameSite=Lax. This will prevent cookies from being used in a cross-domain communication. To overcome this the cookie must have SameSite flag set to None (a newly introduced value) and a Secure flag present.

Required actions:

  • Compile a complete list of cookies used at Regiondo systems. Indicate the following information:
    • Name of the cookie
    • Example value or value type description
    • Domain / path used for the cookie
    • Expiration policy
    • is HttpOnly flag set?
    • is Secure flag set?
    • is used in a cross-domain communication
  • Set the SameSite=None; Secure flags to the cookies that are used in cross-domain communication. The following should be taken in consideration:
    • PHP supports SameSite flag starting from version 7.3, a workaround has to be implemented in case we are not able to upgrade before February 2020, see: https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/samesite-examples/blob/master/php.md.
    • There is a list of clients that don't support the None value for the SameSite flag: https://www.chromium.org/updates/same-site/incompatible-clients. The check has to be implemented on backend in order to support these clients.
  • Set the SameSite=Lax or SameSite=Strict flags on other cookies depending on exact needs explicitly, not to rely on browser default settings.

Note: To test the effect of the new Chrome behavior on your site or cookies you manage, you can go to chrome://flags in Chrome 76+ and enable the “SameSite by default cookies” and “Cookies without SameSite must be secure” experiments. (Or from Firefox 69 in about:config by setting network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure)
